text:
Easily accessible by buses and Downtown MRT to Clarke station.
NTUC club and Saigon Cafe & Bar are within, but building closes at 10:30, after which only one exit available for security management.

Havelock2 is a smaller shopping center between Chinatown and Clarke Quay area.

It houses some restaurants, cafes, bars, nail parlors, hair salons, a law firm, costume shop, toy collectible shops, and few other services.

Most shops do not operate till late.

An newly revamped shopping mall in the area. There an office building above. Many of the shops were not occupied yet. Its rather quiet most of the operating hours expect weekday lunch hours where there lunch crowds where the eateries located at the ground floor gets crowded with office peoples coming for their lunch.

Although located slightly off the transport accessibility, it's nonetheless a quiet mall with limited options except for a few restaurants.

I guess this is one of those malls you'll only come to when there is a reason to.

This shopping mall offers an eclectic mix of stores, cafes, eateries, pubs, karaoke, hair salons and even a law firm. There is something for everyone in this shopping mall even though it is only half occupied,  granted that it's newly opened mid 2018. A number of tenants were previously from Chinatown Square before it was closed to be refurbished into a hotel. You can expect to see interesting toy shops on the 2nd and 3rd level and basement 1 with shops selling creative handmade products. The Wing vintage shop occupied the 3rd floor and is a haven for those who are interested to own a piece of retro or vintage product. Havelock II is connected to Furama city centre by a sheltered walkway allowing easy access if it's raining.
